## AppBuilder.component() method

Register a component with a unique key.

**Signature:**

```typescript
component<K extends string, M>(key: K, builder: ComponentBuilder<M>): AppBuilder<State, Components & Record<K, M>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

key


</td><td>

K


</td><td>

Unique identifier for this component


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

builder


</td><td>

[ComponentBuilder](./dsl.componentbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;M&gt;


</td><td>

Component builder implementing init/update/view


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;State, Components &amp; Record&lt;K, M&gt;&gt;

A new [AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md) with the component registered

## Remarks

Components are TEA models wrapped in a [ComponentBuilder](./dsl.componentbuilder.md) that manages their lifecycle. The component's rendered view is available in the view function via `components[key]`<!-- -->.

## Example


```typescript
createApp()
  .component('loading', spinner())
  .component('input', textInput())
```
